algorithms.curves

Class GeneralizedExtremeValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.curves.GeneralizedExtremeValue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICurveGenerator

    public class GeneralizedExtremeValue
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICurveGenerator
      Generate curves following the Generalized Extreme Value probability density
  function.

                           (   (      ( x-mu))-(1/k))
                           (-1*(1 + k*(-----))      )
                  1        (   (      (sigma))      )   (      ( x-mu))(-1-(1/k))
  y = y_const * ----- * exp                           * (1 + k*(-----))
                sigma                                   (      (sigma))

  mu is  the location parameter
  sigma is the scale parameter and is > 0
  k is the shape parameter


  if k != 0,
      1 + (k * (x-mu)/sigma) > 0


  Let z = (x-mu)/sigma

  Extreme Value Type I:
                      1
      y = y_const * ----- * exp( -z -exp(-z))
                    sigma

      sigma > 0
      k = 0

  Extreme Value Type II:
                      k     (sigma)^(k+1)      (   (sigma)^k)
      y = y_const * ----- * (-----)       * exp( - (-----)  )
                    sigma   (  x  )            (   (  x  )  )

      k  > 0
      sigma > 0
      x > 0

  Extreme Value Type III:
                      k     (x - mu)^(k+1)      (   (x - mu)^k)
      y = y_const * ----- * (------)       * exp( - (------)  )
                    sigma   (sigma )            (   (sigma )  )

                      k
        = y_const * ----- * (z)^(k+1) * exp( -1*(z)^k )
                    sigma

      k < 0
      sigma > 0
      x > 0
    Author:
    nichole

      • calculateWidthFittingError

        public static double calculateWidthFittingError(GEVYFit yFit,
                                float yMaxFactor)
              calculate the error in an area / height calculation for y=0 to y > yLimitFraction where y is
      yLimitFraction to to the right of the peak.  This is useful for determining errors for things
      like FWHM for example.

      For FWHM we have sum of f = sum(X_i*Y_i)_(i < yLimit)/ Y_i

          err^2 = xError^2*(Y_i/Y_i) = xError^2

          it reduces to the sum of the errors in x.  no pde's...
        Parameters:
        yFit -
        yLimitFraction -
        Returns:
